intro: Hieracium xanthocephalum, commonly known as the yellow-centred hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. It features bright yellow flowers with a distinct central disc, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. Hieracium xanthocephalum is often found in open habitats and can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
